name: ollama-code-review
description: Get AI code reviews and generate commit messages from a local Ollama instance before you commit.
author: Vinh Nguyen (vincent)

editor/context.when: editorHasSelection && (editorLangId == javascript || editorLangId == typescript || editorLangId == javascriptreact || editorLangId == typescriptreact || editorLangId == php)

ollama-code-review.preCommitGuard.timeou.description: Timeout in seconds for the AI review during Review & Commit. The review is cancelled if it exceeds this limit.

ollama-code-review.customProfiles.markdownDescription: Custom review profiles that override or extend the built-in profiles (`general`, `security`, `performance`, `accessibility`, `educational`, `strict`). Each profile adjusts the AI's focus area and severity level.

focusAreas.description: List of focus areas for the AI to prioritize

severity.description: How strict the review should be

includeExplanations.description: Whether to include detailed explanations for each finding

ollama-code-review.prompt.review.default:
You are an expert software engineer and code reviewer with deep knowledge of the following frameworks and libraries: **${frameworks}**.
Your task is to analyze the following code changes (in git diff format) and provide constructive, actionable feedback tailored to the conventions, best practices, and common pitfalls of these technologies.
${skills}
**How to Read the Git Diff Format:**
- Lines starting with `---` and `+++` indicate the file names before and after the changes.
- Lines starting with `@@` (e.g., `@@ -15,7 +15,9 @@`) denote the location of the changes within the file.
- Lines starting with a `-` are lines that were DELETED.
- Lines starting with a `+` are lines that were ADDED.
- Lines without a prefix (starting with a space) are for context and have not been changed. **Please focus your review on the added (`+`) and deleted (`-`) lines.**

**Review Focus:**
- Potential bugs or logical errors specific to the frameworks/libraries (${frameworks}).
- Performance optimizations, considering framework-specific patterns.
- Code style inconsistencies or deviations from ${frameworks} best practices.
- Security vulnerabilities, especially those common in ${frameworks}.
- Improvements to maintainability and readability, aligned with ${frameworks} conventions.

**Feedback Requirements:**
1. Explain any issues clearly and concisely, referencing ${frameworks} where relevant.
2. Suggest specific code changes or improvements. Include code snippets for examples where appropriate.
3. Use Markdown for clear formatting.

If you find no issues, please respond with the single sentence: "I have reviewed the changes and found no significant issues."

Here is the code diff to review:
---
${code}
---
ollama-code-review.prompt.review.markdownDescription:
Custom prompt template for code reviews. Available variables:
- `${code}` - The git diff to review
- `${frameworks}` - Comma-separated list of selected frameworks
- `${skills}` - Applied agent skills content
- `${profile}` - Active review profile context (focus areas, severity)

Leave empty to use the built-in default prompt.

ollama-code-review.github.token.description: GitHub Personal Access Token for PR reviews and posting comments (needs 'repo' scope). Also used as fallback for Gists. Get one at https://github.com/settings/tokens

ollama-code-review.github.commentStyle.description: How to post AI reviews to GitHub PRs: summary comment only, inline comments on specific lines, or both

ollama-code-review.github.gistToken.description: GitHub Personal Access Token for creating Gists from review results (needs 'gist' scope). Get one at https://github.com/settings/tokens

ollama-code-review.prompt.commitMessage.default:
You are an expert at writing git commit messages for Semantic Release.
Generate a commit message based on the git diff below following the Conventional Commits specification.

### Structural Requirements:
1. **Subject Line**: <type>(<scope>): <short description>
   - Keep under 50 characters.
   - Use imperative mood ("add" not "added").
   - Types: feat (new feature), fix (bug fix), docs, style, refactor, perf, test, build, ci, chore, revert.
2. **Body**: Explain 'what' and 'why'. Required if the change is complex.
3. **Breaking Changes**: If the diff contains breaking changes, the footer MUST start with "BREAKING CHANGE:" followed by a description.

### Rules:
- If the user's draft mentions a breaking change, prioritize documenting it in the footer.
- Semantic Release triggers: 'feat' for MINOR, 'fix' for PATCH, and 'BREAKING CHANGE' in footer for MAJOR.
- Output ONLY the raw commit message text. No markdown blocks, no "Here is your message," no preamble.

Developer's draft message (may reflect intent):
${draftMessage}

Staged git diff:
---
${diff}
---
ollama-code-review.prompt.commitMessage.markdownDescription:
Custom prompt template for commit message generation. Available variables:
- `${diff}` - The staged git diff
- `${draftMessage}` - Developer's draft message (or "(none provided)")

Leave empty to use the built-in default prompt.

ollama-code-review.notifications.slack.w.markdownDescription: **F-018** — Slack incoming webhook URL. When set, a review summary is posted to your Slack channel after each review. Get a webhook at https://api.slack.com/messaging/webhooks

ollama-code-review.notifications.teams.w.markdownDescription: **F-018** — Microsoft Teams incoming webhook URL. When set, a review summary card is posted to your Teams channel after each review.

ollama-code-review.notifications.discord.markdownDescription: **F-018** — Discord webhook URL. When set, a review embed is posted to your Discord channel after each review.

ollama-code-review.notifications.trigger.markdownDescription: **F-018** — Only send notifications when the review contains findings at or above these severity levels. An empty array always sends notifications regardless of findings.

ollama-code-review.batch.maxFileSizeKb.markdownDescription: **F-019** — Maximum file size in kilobytes for batch file reviews. Files larger than this will be truncated.

ollama-code-review.batch.includeGlob.markdownDescription: **F-019** — Glob pattern for files to include in folder reviews (e.g. `**/*.{ts,js,py}`).

ollama-code-review.batch.excludeGlob.markdownDescription: **F-019** — Comma-separated glob patterns for files to exclude from folder reviews.

ollama-code-review.agentMode.description: F-007 — Configure the agentic multi-step review pipeline. When enabled, reviews go through 5 sequential steps: diff analysis, context gathering, pattern analysis, deep review, and synthesis.

enabled.description: Enable multi-step agentic reviews. When enabled, the 'Agentic Multi-Step Review' command runs a 5-step pipeline for deeper analysis.

maxContextFiles.description: Maximum number of context files to resolve during the gather step

includeTests.description: Include test files in the context gathering step

includeTypes.description: Include .d.ts type definitions in the context gathering step

selfCritique.description: Run a self-critique pass during synthesis to remove false positives and prioritize findings

ollama-code-review.knowledgeBase.description: F-012 — Configure the Team Knowledge Base. When enabled, the extension loads team decisions, patterns, and rules from .ollama-review-knowledge.yaml and injects relevant entries into review prompts.

enabled.description: Load and inject knowledge base entries into review prompts

maxEntries.description: Maximum number of knowledge entries to inject per review

scripts.build: yarn run lint --fix && yarn run compile
scripts.pretest: yarn run compile && yarn run lint --fix
